critique: This executive order concerns the transfer of powers related to war housing from the Secretary of the Treasury to the Federal Works Administrator. It seems to be an administrative action during a time of war, so it is difficult to place on the traditional left-right spectrum. There's no direct impact on immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. The shift of power to the Federal Works Administrator could be seen as a slight increase in federal control, but it's primarily an internal reorganization. There is a slight increase in executive power as it consolidates authority.
